alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 2:57PM AKST until December 08 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches for Anchorage Bowl. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches for the Anchorage Hillside. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph along Turnagain Arm and the Anchorage Hillside. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light snow will develop by late this afternoon. Snow may become heavy, falling at the rate of inch per hour, around the time of the evening commute. The combination of snowfall rates, the dry nature of the snow resuspended by vehicular travel, and the gusty winds along Turnagain Arm and the Anchorage Hillside may significantly reduce visibility to as low as one half mile at times. The snow is expected to become lighter in intensity tonight before tapering off overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
